author: learn-build-service-prod[bot]
message:

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-10-15 11:00 UTC

{"content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [

    "changes": 2,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27/docs%2Farchitecture%2Froad-to-the-cloud-implement.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27/docs%2Farchitecture%2Froad-to-the-cloud-implement.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Farchitecture%2Froad-to-the-cloud-implement.md?ref=b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27",
    "patch": "@@ -65,7 +65,7 @@ These links provide more information about groups:\n \n ## Users\n \n-You and your team might feel compelled to change your current employee provisioning to use cloud-only accounts at this stage. The effort is nontrivial but doesn't provide enough business value. We recommend that you plan this transition at a different phase of your transformation.\n+If there are users in your organization that do not have application dependencies to Active Directory, you can take a cloud-first approach by provisioning those users directly to Microsoft Entra ID. If there are users that do not require access to Active Directory, but have Active Directory accounts provisioned to them, their source of authority can be changed allowing you to clean their Active Directory account. \n \n ## Devices\n "
  },
  {

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Foverview-solutions-customers.md",

    "patch": "@@ -16,6 +16,9 @@ ms.custom: it-pro, sfi-image-nochange\n \n Microsoft Entra External ID offers solutions that let you quickly add intuitive, user-friendly sign-up and sign-up experiences for your consumer and business customer apps. The Woodgrove Groceries demo environment illustrates several of the most common authentication experiences that can be configured for your apps.\n \n+> [!NOTE]\n+> The Woodgrove demo is currently unavailable and may work intermittently. This is a temporary issue while we implement a permanent fix. We apologize for the inconvenience.\n+\n ## Use cases\n \n ### Sign-up with an email and password"
  },

    "sha": "e272532da2826bcd1e75ee60147a303daa23b5b4",
    "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/concept-group-source-of-authority-guidance.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 2,
    "changes": 4,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconcept-group-source-of-authority-guidance.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconcept-group-source-of-authority-guidance.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconcept-group-source-of-authority-guidance.md?ref=b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27",
    "patch": "@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@\n ---\n-title: Guidance for using Group Source of Authority (SOA) in Microsoft Entra ID (Preview)\n+title: Guidance for using Group Source of Authority (SOA) in Microsoft Entra ID\n description: Discover how to manage and transition Active Directory groups to Microsoft Entra ID using Group Source of Authority (SOA). Learn best practices for group management, provisioning, restoring, and rolling back changes in hybrid and cloud environments.\n author: justinha\n manager: dougeby\n@@ -11,7 +11,7 @@ ms.author: justinha\n ms.reviewer: dahnyahk\n ---\n \n-# Guidance for using Group Source of Authority (SOA) (Preview)\n+# Guidance for using Group Source of Authority (SOA)\n \n Managing groups across hybrid environments is essential for organizations that transition from on-premises Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) to the cloud. Group Source of Authority (SOA) in Microsoft Entra ID enables you to transfer group management from AD DS to the cloud, providing greater flexibility, modern governance, and streamlined administration. This guidance explains how to use Group SOA to manage, provision, restore, and roll back groups in hybrid and cloud environments. It explains best practices to clean up groups, convert group management, and ensure secure, efficient access control as you modernize your identity infrastructure.\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "2f5cae7428785e8b516d97c05ba206ee3e77d546",
    "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/concept-group-source-of-authority-how-it-works.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 2,
    "changes": 4,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconcept-group-source-of-authority-how-it-works.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconcept-group-source-of-authority-how-it-works.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconcept-group-source-of-authority-how-it-works.md?ref=b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27",
    "patch": "@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@\n ---\n-title: How to use group Source of Authority (SOA) to manage Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) groups in Microsoft Entra ID (Preview)\n+title: How to use group Source of Authority (SOA) to manage Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) groups in Microsoft Entra ID\n description: Learn how to convert group management from Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) to Microsoft Entra ID using group source of authority (SOA).\n author: justinha\n manager: dougeby\n@@ -10,7 +10,7 @@ ms.date: 08/01/2025\n ms.author: justinha\n ms.reviewer: dahnyahk\n ---\n-# How group Source of Authority (SOA) works (Preview)\n+# How group Source of Authority (SOA) works\n \n You can convert the Source of Authority (SOA) of a group from Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) to Microsoft Entra ID. After you convert the SOA, the group becomes cloud-owned, and you can map it to a corresponding cloud group type in the cloud. For a list of supported groups types, see [How to manage cloud security groups](concept-group-source-of-authority-guidance.md#how-to-manage-cloud-security-groups).\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "4f67ce7cab8f795c328b05d4b6d53937cd75492f",
    "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/concept-source-of-authority-overview.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 2,
    "changes": 4,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconcept-source-of-authority-overview.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconcept-source-of-authority-overview.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fconcept-source-of-authority-overview.md?ref=b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27",
    "patch": "@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@\n ---\n-title: Embrace cloud-first posture and convert Group Source of Authority (SOA) to the cloud (Preview)\n+title: Embrace cloud-first posture and convert Group Source of Authority (SOA) to the cloud\n description: Learn about Source of Authority (SOA), including prerequisites, supported scenarios, and step-by-step guidance for IT Architects and Administrators.\n author: justinha\n ms.date: 08/19/2025\n@@ -8,7 +8,7 @@ ms.reviewer: dhanyahk\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: article\n ---\n-# Embrace cloud-first posture: Convert Group Source of Authority to the cloud (Preview)\n+# Embrace cloud-first posture: Convert Group Source of Authority to the cloud\n \n Modernization requirements have many organizations shifting Identity and Access Management (IAM) solutions from on-premises to the cloud. For the road to the cloud initiative, Microsoft has [modeled five states of transformation](/entra/architecture/road-to-the-cloud-posture#five-states-of-transformation) to align with customer business goals.\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "b85dba7c2cf229c7e190c8b1244020c4deac4a71",

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fhow-to-group-source-of-authority-configure.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fhow-to-group-source-of-authority-configure.md?ref=b2d804e69ed76b63756f796910832ad516f68e27",
    "patch": "@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@\n ---\n-title: Configure Group Source of Authority (SOA) in Microsoft Entra ID (Preview)\n+title: Configure Group Source of Authority (SOA) in Microsoft Entra ID\n description: Learn how to convert group management from Active Directory Domain Services to Microsoft Entra ID by using Group Source of Authority (SOA).\n author: Justinha\n manager: dougeby\n@@ -11,9 +11,9 @@ ms.author: justinha\n ms.reviewer: dhanyak\n ---\n \n-# Configure Group Source of Authority (SOA) (Preview)\n+# Configure Group Source of Authority (SOA)\n \n-This article explains the prerequisites and steps to configure Group Source of Authority (SOA), how to revert changes, and limitations. For more information about Group SOA, see [Embrace cloud-first posture: Convert Group Source of Authority to the cloud (Preview)](concept-source-of-authority-overview.md). \n+This article explains the prerequisites and steps to configure Group Source of Authority (SOA), how to revert changes, and limitations. For more information about Group SOA, see [Embrace cloud-first posture: Convert Group Source of Authority to the cloud](concept-source-of-authority-overview.md). \n \n ## Prerequisites\n \n@@ -96,7 +96,7 @@ Follow these steps to convert the SOA for a test group:\n 1. Let's check the existing SOA status. We didn’t update the SOA yet, so the *isCloudManaged* attribute value should be false. Replace the *{ID}* in the following examples with the object ID of your group. For more information about this API, see [Get onPremisesSyncBehavior](/graph/api/onpremisessyncbehavior-get).\n \n    ```https\n-   GET https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/groups/{ID}/onPremisesSyncBehavior?$select=isCloudManaged\n+   GET https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/groups/{ID}/onPremisesSyncBehavior?$select=isCloudManaged\n    ```\n \n    :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/how-to-group-source-of-authority-configure/get-group.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of how to use Microsoft Graph Explorer to get the SOA value of a group.\":::\n@@ -124,7 +124,7 @@ Follow these steps to convert the SOA for a test group:\n 1. Now you can update the SOA of group to be cloud-managed. Run the following operation in Microsoft Graph Explorer for the group object you want to convert to the cloud. For more information about this API, see [Update onPremisesSyncBehavior](/graph/api/onpremisessyncbehavior-update).\n \n    ```https\n-   PATCH https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/groups/{ID}/onPremisesSyncBehavior\n+   PATCH https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/groups/{ID}/onPremisesSyncBehavior\n       {\n         \"isCloudManaged\": true\n       }   \n@@ -135,7 +135,7 @@ Follow these steps to convert the SOA for a test group:\n 1. To validate the change, call GET to verify *isCloudManaged* is true.\n \n    ```https\n-   GET https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/groups/{ID}/onPremisesSyncBehavior?$select=isCloudManaged\n+   GET https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/groups/{ID}/onPremisesSyncBehavior?$select=isCloudManaged\n    ```\n \n    :::image type=\"content\" border=\"true\" source=\"media/how-to-group-source-of-authority-configure/cloud-managed.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshot of GET call to verify group properties.\":::\n@@ -205,48 +205,143 @@ Follow these steps to convert the SOA for a test group:\n You can use the following PowerShell script to automate Group SOA updates by using app-based authentication.\n \n ```powershell\n-# Define your Microsoft Entra ID app details and tenant information\n-$tenantId = \"\"\n-$clientId = \"\"\n-$certThumbprint = \"\"\n-\n-# Connect to Microsoft Graph as App-Only using a certificate. The app registration must have the Group.Read.All Group-OnPremisesSyncBehavior.ReadWrite.All permissions granted.\n-Connect-MgGraph -ClientId $clientId -TenantId $tenantId -CertificateThumbprint $certThumbprint\n+<#\n+.SYNOPSIS\n+    Updates groups to set isCloudManaged parameter to true for on-premises synchronized groups.\n+\n+.DESCRIPTION\n+    This script reads a file containing group Ids, checks each group's OnPremisesSyncEnabled property,\n+    and if true, calls the onPremisesSyncBehavior API to set isCloudManaged to true.\n+\n+.PARAMETER FilePath\n+    Mandatory. Path to the file containing group Ids (one per line).\n+\n+.PARAMETER WhatIf\n+    Boolean parameter. When true (default), shows what would be done without making actual changes.\n+\n+.EXAMPLE\n+    .\\Update-GroupSoA.ps1 -FilePath \"C:\\temp\\groups.txt\"\n+    .\\Update-GroupSoA.ps1 -FilePath \"C:\\temp\\groups.txt\" -WhatIf $false\n+\n+.NOTES\n+    Requires Microsoft.Graph PowerShell module to be installed and appropriate permissions.\n+    Required Graph permissions: Group.ReadWrite.All, Group-OnPremisesSyncBehavior.ReadWrite.All\n+\n+    Input file should contain one group Id (GUID) per line.\n+#>\n+\n+[CmdletBinding()]\n+param(\n+    [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)]\n+    [string]$FilePath,\n+\n+    [Parameter(Mandatory = $false)]\n+    [bool]$WhatIf = $true\n+)\n+\n+# Import Groups module\n+try {\n+    $moduleName = \"Microsoft.Graph.Groups\"\n+    if (-not (Get-Module -Name $moduleName)) {\n+        Import-Module -Name $moduleName\n+    }\n+    Write-Host \"Successfully imported Microsoft Graph modules.\"\n+}\n+catch {\n+    Write-Error \"Failed to import Microsoft Graph modules. Please ensure Microsoft.Graph PowerShell SDK is installed.\"\n+    Write-Host \"Install with: Install-Module Microsoft.Graph -Scope CurrentUser\"\n+    exit 1\n+}\n \n-#Connect to Microsoft Graph using delegated permissions\n-#Connect-MgGraph -Scopes \"Group.Read.All Group-OnPremisesSyncBehavior.ReadWrite.All\" -TenantId $tenantId\n+# Connect to MS Graph\n+$context = Get-MgContext\n+if (-not $context) {\n+    Connect-MgGraph -Scopes 'Group.ReadWrite.All', 'Group-OnPremisesSyncBehavior.ReadWrite.All'\n+}\n \n-# Define the group name you want to query\n-$groupName = \"HR India\"\n+# Validate input file\n+if (-not (Test-Path $FilePath)) {\n+    Write-Error \"Input file not found: $FilePath\"\n+    exit 1\n+}\n \n-# Retrieve the group using group name\n-$group = Get-MgBetaGroup -Filter \"displayName eq '$groupName'\"\n+Write-Host \"Starting group update process using $FilePath (WhatIf: $WhatIf)...\"\n+Write-Host \"-----------------------------------\"\n \n-# Ensure group is found\n-if ($null -ne $group)\n-{\n-    $groupObjectID = $($group.Id)\n-    # Define the Microsoft Graph API endpoint for the group\n-    $url = \"https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/groups/$groupObjectID/onPremisesSyncBehavior\"\n+# Read group Ids from file\n+$groupGuids = Get-Content $FilePath\n \n-    # Define the JSON payload for the PATCH request\n-    $jsonPayload = @{\n-        isCloudManaged = \"true\"\n-    } | ConvertTo-Json\n+if ($groupGuids.Count -eq 0) {\n+    Write-Error \"No group Ids found in the input file.\"\n+    exit 1\n+}\n \n-    # Make the PATCH request to update the JSON payload\n-    Invoke-MgGraphRequest -Uri $url -Method Patch -ContentType \"application/json\" -Body $jsonPayload\n+Write-Host \"Found $($groupGuids.Count) group Ids to process.\"\n+\n+# Initialize counters for summary\n+$totalGroups = $groupGuids.Count\n+$processedCount = 0\n+$updatedCount = 0\n+$skippedCount = 0\n+$errorCount = 0\n+\n+# Process each group\n+foreach ($groupId in $groupGuids) {\n+    $processedCount++\n+    Write-Host \"`nProcessing $groupId ($processedCount/$totalGroups)\"\n+\n+    try {\n+        $group = Get-MgGroup -GroupId $groupId -Property \"Id,DisplayName,OnPremisesSyncEnabled\"\n+\n+        Write-Host \"Group Name: $($group.DisplayName)\"\n+        Write-Host \"OnPremisesSyncEnabled: $($group.OnPremisesSyncEnabled)\"\n+\n+        if ($group.OnPremisesSyncEnabled -eq $true) {\n+            $actionDescription = \"Set isCloudManaged to true for group '$($group.DisplayName)'\"\n+\n+            if ($WhatIf) {\n+                Write-Host \"Skipping since WhatIf is enabled: $actionDescription\"\n+                $skippedCount++\n+            }\n+            else {\n+                try {\n+                    # Call the onPremisesSyncBehavior API to set isCloudManaged to true\n+                    $body = @{\n+                        isCloudManaged = $true\n+                    }\n+\n+                    $uri = \"https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/groups/$groupId/onPremisesSyncBehavior\"\n+                    Invoke-MgGraphRequest -Uri $uri -Method PATCH -Body ($body | ConvertTo-Json) -ContentType \"application/json\"\n+\n+                    Write-Host \"SUCCESS: Updated group to cloud-managed\"\n+                    $updatedCount++\n+                }\n+                catch {\n+                    Write-Host \"ERROR: Failed to update group: $_\"\n+                    $errorCount++\n+                }\n+            }\n+        }\n+        else {\n+            Write-Host \"SKIPPED: Group is not on-premises synchronized\"\n+            $skippedCount++\n+        }\n+    }\n+    catch {\n+        Write-Host \"ERROR: Failed to retrieve group information: $_\"\n+        $errorCount++\n+    }\n+}\n \n-    $result = Invoke-MgGraphRequest -Method Get -Uri \"https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/groups/$groupObjectID/onPremisesSyncBehavior?`$select=id,isCloudManaged\"\n+Write-Host \"`n-----------------------------------\"\n+Write-Host \"SUMMARY\"\n+Write-Host \"-----------------------------------\"\n+Write-Host \"Total groups processed: $totalGroups\"\n+Write-Host \"Successfully updated: $updatedCount\"\n+Write-Host \"Skipped (not sync-enabled or WhatIf): $skippedCount\"\n+Write-Host \"Errors encountered: $errorCount\"\n \n-    Write-Host \"Group Name: $($group.DisplayName)\"\n-    Write-Host \"Group ID: $($result.id)\"\n-    Write-Host \"SOA Converted: $($result.isCloudManaged)\"\n-}\n-else \n-{\n-    Write-Warning \"Group '$groupName' not found.\"\n-}\n+Write-Host \"`nScript completed.\"\n ```\n \n ### Status of attributes after you convert SOA\n@@ -263,12 +358,12 @@ Admin creates a cloud native object in Microsoft Entra ID | `false` | `null` | I\n ## Roll back SOA update\n \n > [!IMPORTANT] \n-> Make sure that the groups that you roll back have no cloud references. Remove cloud users from SOA converted groups, and remove these groups from access packages before you roll back the group to AD DS. The sync client takes over the object in the next sync cycle.\n+> Make sure that the groups that you roll back have no cloud references. Remove cloud users from SOA converted groups, and remove these groups from access packages before you roll back the group to AD DS. The sync client takes over the object in the next sync cycle. For a sample PowerShell script to identify and remove cloud users from groups, see: [Script to identify cloud members (users) of a group](how-to-group-source-of-authority-configure.md#script-to-identify-cloud-members-users-of-a-group).\n \n You can run this operation to roll back the SOA update and revert the SOA to on-premises. \n \n    ```https\n-   PATCH https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/groups/{ID}/onPremisesSyncBehavior\n+   PATCH https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/groups/{ID}/onPremisesSyncBehavior\n       {\n         \"isCloudManaged\": false\n       }   \n@@ -307,6 +402,158 @@ Select activity as **Undo changes to Source of Authority from AD DS to cloud**:\n \n - **No support for extension attributes (1-15)**: Extension attributes 1–15 aren't supported on cloud security groups and aren't supported after SOA is converted.\n \n+\n+## Script to identify cloud members (users) of a group\n+\n+ \n+The following script can be used to identify and remove cloud users from groups:\n+\n+\n+```powershell\n+<#\n+.SYNOPSIS\n+    Finds cloud users in an Entra ID group and optionally removes them.\n+\n+.DESCRIPTION\n+    This script pages through all users in a specified Entra ID group, identifies cloud users\n+    (users where onPremisesSyncEnabled is not set to true), and prints their details.\n+    Optionally removes these users from the group if removeUsers is set to true.\n+\n+.PARAMETER GroupId\n+    The GUID of the Entra ID group to process. This parameter is required.\n+\n+.PARAMETER RemoveUsers\n+    Boolean flag to indicate whether to remove cloud users from the group. \n+    Default is false (optional parameter).\n+\n+.EXAMPLE\n+    .\\Find-CloudUsersInGroup.ps1 -GroupId \"12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012\"\n+    .\\Find-CloudUsersInGroup.ps1 -GroupId \"12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012\" -RemoveUsers $true\n+\n+.NOTES\n+    Requires Microsoft.Graph PowerShell module to be installed and appropriate permissions.\n+    Required Graph permissions: Group.Read.All, GroupMember.Read.All, User.Read.All and GroupMember.ReadWrite.All (if removing users)\n+#>\n+\n+[CmdletBinding()]\n+param(\n+    [Parameter(Mandatory = $true)]\n+    [System.Guid]$GroupId,\n+\n+    [Parameter(Mandatory = $false)]\n+    [bool]$RemoveUsers = $false\n+)\n+\n+# Import required modules\n+try {\n+    $moduleName = \"Microsoft.Graph.Groups\"\n+    if (-not (Get-Module -Name $moduleName)) {\n+        Import-Module -Name $moduleName\n+    }\n+    $moduleName = \"Microsoft.Graph.Users\"\n+    if (-not (Get-Module -Name $moduleName)) {\n+        Import-Module -Name $moduleName\n+    }\n+    Write-Host \"Microsoft Graph modules imported successfully\"\n+}\n+catch {\n+    Write-Error \"Failed to import Microsoft Graph modules. Please install Microsoft.Graph PowerShell module.\"\n+    Write-Error \"Run: Install-Module Microsoft.Graph -Scope CurrentUser\"\n+    exit 1\n+}\n+\n+# Connect to MS Graph and verify the group exists\n+$context = Get-MgContext\n+if (-not $context) {\n+    Connect-MgGraph -Scopes 'Group.Read.All','GroupMember.Read.All','GroupMember.ReadWrite.All','User.Read.All'\n+}\n+\n+$group = Get-MgGroup -GroupId $GroupId -Property \"Id,DisplayName,MailEnabled\"\n+Write-Host \"Processing group: $($group.DisplayName) (ID: $GroupId)\"\n+\n+if ($group.MailEnabled -eq $true) {\n+    Write-Warning \"The specified group is mail-enabled. Users can only be identified using this script. To remove users, use Exchange.\"\n+}\n+\n+# Initialize counters\n+$totalUsers = 0\n+$cloudUsers = 0\n+$removedUsers = 0\n+\n+Write-Host \"`nStarting to process group users...\"\n+\n+try {\n+    # Get all group members that are users\n+    $usersInGroup = Get-MgGroupMemberAsUser -GroupId $GroupId -All -Property \"Id\"\n+\n+    if ($usersInGroup.Count -ge 1) {\n+        $totalUsers = $usersInGroup.Count\n+        Write-Host \"Found $totalUsers total users in the group\"\n+    }\n+    else {\n+        Write-Host \"No users found in the group\"\n+        exit 0\n+    }\n+}\n+catch {\n+    Write-Error \"Failed to retrieve group users: $($_.Exception.Message)\"\n+    exit 1\n+}\n+\n+Write-Host \"`nProcessing each user to identify cloud users...\"\n+Write-Host \"-----------------\"\n+\n+# Process each user\n+foreach ($user in $usersInGroup) {\n+    try {\n+        # Get detailed user information\n+        $user = Get-MgUser -UserId $user.Id -Property \"Id,DisplayName,UserPrincipalName,OnPremisesSyncEnabled\"\n+\n+        # Check if user is a cloud user\n+        $isCloudUser = -not $user.OnPremisesSyncEnabled\n+\n+        if ($isCloudUser) {\n+            $cloudUsers++\n+\n+            # Print cloud user details\n+            Write-Host \"Cloud User Found:\"\n+            Write-Host \"  Object ID: $($user.Id)\"\n+            Write-Host \"  Display Name: $($user.DisplayName)\"\n+            Write-Host \"  User Principal Name: $($user.UserPrincipalName)\"\n+            Write-Host \"  OnPremisesSyncEnabled: $($user.OnPremisesSyncEnabled)\"\n+\n+            # Remove user from group if requested\n+            if ($RemoveUsers) {\n+                Remove-MgGroupMemberByRef -GroupId $GroupId -DirectoryObjectId $user.Id -ErrorAction Stop\n+                Write-Host \"REMOVED from group\"\n+                $removedUsers++\n+            }\n+        }\n+    }\n+    catch {\n+        Write-Warning \"Failed to process User ID $($user.Id): $($_.Exception.Message)\"\n+    }\n+}\n+\n+# Summary\n+Write-Host \"-----------------\"\n+Write-Host \"SUMMARY:\"\n+Write-Host \"-----------------\"\n+Write-Host \"Total group users processed: $totalUsers\"\n+Write-Host \"Cloud users identified: $cloudUsers\"\n+if ($RemoveUsers) {\n+    Write-Host \"Cloud users successfully removed: $removedUsers\"\n+}\n+\n+if ($cloudUsers -eq 0) {\n+    Write-Host \"No cloud users found in this group.\"\n+}\n+\n+Write-Host \"`nScript completed.\"\n+```\n+\n+This script is being provided as an example and should not be considered as official guidance on how to identify and remove cloud users from group memberships.\n+\n ## Related content\n \n - [Group SOA overview](concept-source-of-authority-overview.md)"
  },

    "patch": "@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@\n ---\n-title: How to audit and monitor Group Source of Authority (SOA) in Microsoft Entra ID (Preview)\n+title: How to audit and monitor Group Source of Authority (SOA) in Microsoft Entra ID\n description: Learn how to audit and monitor Group Source of Authority (SOA) in Microsoft Entra ID.\n author: Justinha\n manager: dougeby\n@@ -11,7 +11,7 @@ ms.author: justinha\n ms.reviewer: dhanyak\n ---\n \n-# How to audit and monitor Group Source of Authority (SOA) in Microsoft Entra ID (Preview)\n+# How to audit and monitor Group Source of Authority (SOA) in Microsoft Entra ID\n \n Admins can use **Audit Logs** in the Azure portal or the onPremisesSyncBehavior Microsoft Graph API to monitor and report SOA changes in their environment. They can also integrate SOA changes with third-party monitoring systems. For more information, see [onPremisesSyncBehavior](/graph/api/resources/onpremisessyncbehavior).\n "
  },

    "patch": "@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@\n ---\n-title: Set up self-service group management after Group SOA conversion (Preview)\n+title: Set up self-service group management after Group SOA conversion\n description: Configure self-service group management in Microsoft Entra for security groups, mail-enabled security groups, and distribution groups after SOA conversion.\n author: Justinha\n ms.service: entra-id\n@@ -11,7 +11,7 @@ manager: dougeby\n ms.reviewer: mbhargav\n ---\n \n-# Set up self-service group management after Group Source of Authority (SOA) conversion (Preview)\n+# Set up self-service group management after Group Source of Authority (SOA) conversion\n \n When you convert groups to Microsoft Entra using Source of Authority (SOA), enabling self-service group management empowers your users to manage their own group memberships while reducing administrative overhead. This article explains how to configure self-service group management for different group types after SOA conversion, including the capabilities, limitations, and best practices for each group type.\n "

ai_summary.Response: The changes focus on updating documentation related to Microsoft Entra ID's Group Source of Authority (SOA) feature. This includes removing the "(Preview)" tag from titles and descriptions, clarifying guidance on user provisioning and managing groups, and adding more detailed PowerShell scripts for automating SOA updates and identifying/removing cloud users from groups. A note has also been added regarding the temporary unavailability of the Woodgrove Groceries demo environment.
